text: I have this conversation regularly and accurate attribution to content is never going to be fully accurate. There is decent Martech out there that helps but with rise of gated platforms, privacy issues and the Dark Funnel its not reliable. The solution is usually educational to the C-suite that all the micro metrics have a net positive effect on the only thing that's matters - revenue. If you want that high degree of accuracy you need to go get qualitative feedback. More painful but mighty.

text: Agree with <@U01P13NTGG6> but you also have to know enough about your content to be able to push back on leadership’s request. If your position is new and the company hasn’t really done content marketing before, they shouldn’t be expecting you to generate leads and revenue. In that case, metrics that could eventually lead to leads and revenue (ranking keywords, organic traffic, etc.) might be better to focus on for now.

text: Agreed with you there, <@U02ME70EHBL>. The current situation definitely matters. In those situations we use ranking velocity and traffic velocity as leading indicators of future revenue but we typically focus on high-intent topics first so we can get validation as soon as possible (for B2B anyway).
